results.title: Unemployment
results.creator_credit: Graeme Turner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Making Sense of Society”.
Presents two real-life cases of individuals who have actually experienced being unemployed. Dave Hunt of Sunderland has been out of work for 8 years. John Lockyer of Watford was unemployed for 4 months in 1971 but has been continuously in employment since then. Demonstrates the effect unemployment has had on their lives and their families.

results.title: Unemployment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
(HSC Economics series) Covers definitions of terms, general and specific causes and measurement of unvoluntary unemployment and the scenario relating to unemployment with productivity and demand. No other credits available.

results.title: Une Semaine de bonte, ou, Les sept elements capitaux
results.creator_credit: Jean Desvilles and Les Productions Tanit
results.brief_description: Pictures the work of Max Ernst in which he uses Victorian engravings to animate a Gothic tale of a world where only the inconceivable represents the norm. Narrated in English.

results.title: Une job steady - un bon boss
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren, Jean-V. Dufresne and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Ask any French Canadian, who tells the funniest stories and he’ll say with a chuckle Yvon Deschamps. Now big box office, Deschamps grew up in Montreal’s inner city, where, he says, mothers didn’t speak, they just hit. Here he is, on and off stage, quipping, haranguing with irreverent wit-the very embodiment of Quebec humour and slant on life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian McLaren, Jean-V. Dufresne and ONF | NFB

results.title: Une Famille Bretonne
results.brief_description: Part of the French Language Series, this is the story of the film “French children” told in simple French by a teacher-narrator, born in France. Told in the present tense and avoiding all subjunctives, the narration is levelled at the needs of beginners and provides practice in the understanding of spoken French. The film portrays family life on a farm in Brittany. It illustrates the work of each member of the family and includes scenes of the village school and a neighbouring town.

results.title: Underwater medicine
results.creator_credit: Bruce Davis and Australia. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: Shows the work on prevention and treatment of ailments afflicting divers being done by the School of Underwater Medicine at HMAS Penguin, a Naval shore establishment at Balmoral, Sydney. Shows the treatment of injured civilian diver, the education of medical personnel and the research projects being undertaken by the school in association with Sydney universities.

results.title: Understanding: family and marriage
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw, Elaine Grand and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: This film looks at responsibility within the family, communication between members of a family and married couples and the idea of divorce as it relates to different concepts of the ideal marriage.

results.title: Understanding venereal disease
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw, Elaine Grand and Granada Television
results.brief_description: A round table discussion between a number of teenagers, a venereal disease specialist and Granada’s compere, is designed to inform teenagers about VD. Specifically informs on the types of VD, their known incidence in Britain, how to recognise symptoms, what should be done about it and where treatment may be obtained. The doctor states that early treatment is most necessary. The young people feel that information on VD should be given in schools as well as information on sex.

results.title: Understanding the Japanese
results.creator_credit: Shinichi Koike, Haruhiko Kawamura and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: A round-table social commentary by foreigners living in Japan including a professor and an employee of a Japanese company from Australia; a BBC producer as well as a freelance translater from England; a professor from Canada; and a lecturer of comparative culture from America.
